intro: Bulbostylis sphaerocephala var. macrocephala, commonly known as the giant sphaerocephala bulbostylis, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its compact, rounded inflorescence and small, spikelet-like flowers. Its bulbs are an important feature, serving as storage organs for nutrients. This variant is distinguished by its larger, more prominent inflorescence compared to the typical form.
